text: Hibbertia bracteata is a species of perennial shrub, in the family Dilleniaceae, that is endemic to the Sydney and Blue Mountains region in Australia. It has small yellow five-petalled flowers. Each flower sits on a ring of brown bracts. Flowering occurs from late winter to summer. This plant may reach one metre in height, the habitat is heath and woodland.Les Robinson - Field Guide to the Native Plants of Sydney, page 159 ==References== bracteata Category:Flora of New South Wales
title: Hibbertia bracteata
